tasks.title: Extend Nano vLLM Configuration for Medical Models
tasks.description: Adapt the core Nano vLLM engine configuration system to support medical models like BioBERT and ClinicalBERT.
tasks.details:
Modify the configuration system to include medical model-specific parameters:
1. Create a new `MedicalModelConfig` class that extends the base configuration
2. Add parameters for medical domain tasks (classification, NER, generation)
3. Implement configuration validation for medical models
4. Update configuration loading/saving to handle medical-specific parameters
5. Ensure backward compatibility with existing Nano vLLM configurations

Example implementation:
```python
class MedicalModelConfig(ModelConfig):
    def __init__(self, model_type="biobert", task_type="classification", **kwargs):
        super().__init__(**kwargs)
        self.model_type = model_type  # "biobert" or "clinicalbert"
        self.task_type = task_type    # "classification", "ner", or "generation"
        self.medical_specific_params = {
            "entity_types": ["disease", "drug", "procedure"],
            "classification_labels": ["diagnosis", "treatment", "test"],
        }
```
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Unit tests for configuration loading/saving with medical parameters
2. Validation tests to ensure configuration constraints are enforced
3. Compatibility tests with existing Nano vLLM configurations
4. Integration tests to verify configuration works with model loading

subtasks.details: Modify the to_dict(), from_dict(), to_json(), and from_json() methods to handle medical-specific parameters. Ensure proper serialization of complex medical data types. Update any file handling code to support the extended configuration format.

subtasks.details: Add version checking to detect older configuration formats. Create migration functions to upgrade older configurations to the new format. Implement fallback mechanisms for missing medical parameters. Test with various versions of configuration files to verify compatibility.

tasks.title: Integrate BioBERT and ClinicalBERT Models
tasks.description: Integrate BioBERT and ClinicalBERT models with the Nano vLLM architecture using an adapter pattern to ensure compatibility.
tasks.details:
Create adapters to integrate medical models with Nano vLLM:
1. Implement `BioBERTModel` adapter class to wrap BioBERT
2. Implement `ClinicalBERTModel` adapter class to wrap ClinicalBERT
3. Ensure compatibility with Nano vLLM's tensor parallelism and CUDA optimizations
4. Adapt the attention mechanisms and layer structures to work with Nano vLLM
5. Implement efficient KV caching for medical models

Example implementation:
```python
class MedicalModelAdapter:
    def __init__(self, model, config):
        self.model = model
        self.config = config
        self.kv_cache = None
        
    def setup_for_inference(self):
        # Configure model for inference with Nano vLLM optimizations
        self.model.eval()
        # Setup CUDA graphs if available
        self.cuda_graphs = setup_cuda_graphs(self.model) if self.config.use_cuda_graphs else None
        # Initialize KV cache
        self.kv_cache = initialize_kv_cache(self.config)
        
    def forward(self, input_ids, attention_mask=None):
        # Adapt the input format for medical models
        if self.config.model_type == "biobert":
            # BioBERT specific processing
            return self._biobert_forward(input_ids, attention_mask)
        else:
            # ClinicalBERT specific processing
            return self._clinicalbert_forward(input_ids, attention_mask)
            
    def _biobert_forward(self, input_ids, attention_mask):
        # BioBERT specific forward pass with KV caching
        # ...
        
    def _clinicalbert_forward(self, input_ids, attention_mask):
        # ClinicalBERT specific forward pass with KV caching
        # ...
```

tasks.title: Implement Medical Text Classification Module
tasks.description: Develop a specialized module for medical text classification tasks that leverages the underlying medical models.
tasks.details:
Create a text classification module for medical applications:
1. Implement `TextClassifier` class that handles medical text classification
2. Add support for common medical classification tasks (diagnosis, procedure categorization, etc.)
3. Implement confidence scoring for classifications
4. Add multi-label classification capabilities
5. Create result visualization and explanation methods

Example implementation:
```python
class TextClassifier:
    def __init__(self, inference_pipeline, config):
        self.pipeline = inference_pipeline
        self.config = config
        self.labels = config.classification_labels
        
    def classify(self, text, return_probabilities=False):
        # Run inference with classification task
        result = self.pipeline.run_inference(text, task_type="classification")
        
        # Get predicted label and confidence
        predicted_label = self.labels[result.label_id]
        confidence = result.confidence
        
        if return_probabilities:
            # Return full probability distribution
            probabilities = {label: prob for label, prob in zip(self.labels, result.probabilities)}
            return ClassificationResult(predicted_label, confidence, probabilities)
        else:
            return ClassificationResult(predicted_label, confidence)
            
    def batch_classify(self, texts, batch_size=8):
        # Process multiple texts in batches
        results = []
        for i in range(0, len(texts), batch_size):
            batch = texts[i:i+batch_size]
            batch_results = [self.classify(text) for text in batch]
            results.extend(batch_results)
        return results
        
    def explain_classification(self, text):
        # Provide explanation for classification decision
        # Implement using attention weights or other explainability methods
        # ...
```

tasks.title: Implement Medical Named Entity Recognition Module
tasks.description: Develop a specialized module for medical named entity recognition that can identify medical entities in text.
tasks.details:
Create a named entity recognition module for medical applications:
1. Implement `NERProcessor` class for medical entity extraction
2. Add support for common medical entity types (diseases, drugs, procedures, etc.)
3. Implement entity linking to medical ontologies
4. Add context-aware entity resolution
5. Create visualization tools for entity highlighting

Example implementation:
```python
class NERProcessor:
    def __init__(self, inference_pipeline, config):
        self.pipeline = inference_pipeline
        self.config = config
        self.entity_types = config.entity_types
        
    def extract_entities(self, text):
        # Run inference with NER task
        result = self.pipeline.run_inference(text, task_type="ner")
        
        # Process entities
        entities = []
        for entity in result.entities:
            entity_type = self.entity_types[entity.type_id]
            entities.append({
                "text": entity.text,
                "type": entity_type,
                "start": entity.start,
                "end": entity.end,
                "confidence": entity.confidence
            })
            
        return NERResult(text, entities)
        
    def link_entities(self, ner_result, ontology="UMLS"):
        # Link extracted entities to medical ontologies
        linked_entities = []
        for entity in ner_result.entities:
            # Lookup entity in the specified ontology
            ontology_links = lookup_in_ontology(entity["text"], entity["type"], ontology)
            linked_entity = entity.copy()
            linked_entity["ontology_links"] = ontology_links
            linked_entities.append(linked_entity)
            
        return NERResult(ner_result.text, linked_entities)
        
    def highlight_entities(self, ner_result, format="html"):
        # Generate visualization of entities in text
        # ...
```

tasks.title: Implement Medical Text Generation Module
tasks.description: Develop a specialized module for generating medically accurate text based on prompts and context.
tasks.details:
Create a text generation module for medical applications:
1. Implement `TextGenerator` class for medical text generation
2. Add support for different generation strategies (greedy, beam search, sampling)
3. Implement medical-specific constraints and filters
4. Add factual consistency checking for medical information
5. Create methods for controlling generation length and style

Example implementation:
```python
class TextGenerator:
    def __init__(self, inference_pipeline, config):
        self.pipeline = inference_pipeline
        self.config = config
        
    def generate(self, prompt, max_length=100, strategy="beam", temperature=0.7, top_p=0.9):
        # Set generation parameters
        generation_params = {
            "max_length": max_length,
            "strategy": strategy,
            "temperature": temperature,
            "top_p": top_p,
            "medical_constraints": self.config.medical_constraints
        }
        
        # Run inference with generation task
        result = self.pipeline.run_inference(
            prompt, 
            task_type="generation",
            generation_params=generation_params
        )
        
        # Process and return generated text
        return GenerationResult(
            prompt=prompt,
            generated_text=result.text,
            metadata={
                "strategy": strategy,
                "temperature": temperature,
                "top_p": top_p
            }
        )
        
    def check_medical_accuracy(self, generated_text):
        # Verify medical facts in generated text
        # This could use a medical knowledge base or another model
        # ...
        
    def generate_with_context(self, prompt, context, **kwargs):
        # Generate text with additional medical context
        combined_input = f"Context: {context}\n\nPrompt: {prompt}"
        return self.generate(combined_input, **kwargs)
```

tasks.title: Develop Command-Line Interface
tasks.description: Create a comprehensive command-line interface for Med vLLM that allows users to run inference, select models, and execute different medical NLP tasks.
tasks.details:
Implement a CLI for Med vLLM:
1. Create `run_inference.py` script with model and task selection
2. Implement argument parsing for all supported parameters
3. Add clear error messages and user guidance
4. Implement progress indicators for long-running operations
5. Create example commands for common medical NLP tasks

Example implementation:
```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
import argparse
import sys
from med_vllm import ModelRegistry, MedicalInferencePipeline, TextClassifier, NERProcessor, TextGenerator

def main():
    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description="Med vLLM: Medical Language Model Inference")
    
    # Model selection arguments
    parser.add_argument("--model", type=str, choices=["biobert", "clinicalbert"], default="biobert",
                        help="Medical model to use for inference")
    
    # Task selection arguments
    parser.add_argument("--task", type=str, choices=["classification", "ner", "generation"], required=True,
                        help="Medical NLP task to perform")
    
    # Input arguments
    parser.add_argument("--input", type=str, help="Input text or file path")
    parser.add_argument("--input-file", type=str, help="Path to input file")
    
    # Task-specific arguments
    classification_group = parser.add_argument_group("Classification options")
    classification_group.add_argument("--return-probabilities", action="store_true", help="Return probability distribution")
    
    ner_group = parser.add_argument_group("NER options")
    ner_group.add_argument("--link-entities", action="store_true", help="Link entities to medical ontologies")
    ner_group.add_argument("--ontology", type=str, default="UMLS", help="Ontology for entity linking")
    
    generation_group = parser.add_argument_group("Generation options")
    generation_group.add_argument("--max-length", type=int, default=100, help="Maximum generation length")
    generation_group.add_argument("--temperature", type=float, default=0.7, help="Sampling temperature")
    
    # Parse arguments
    args = parser.parse_args()
    
    # Load model and create pipeline
    try:
        registry = ModelRegistry()
        registry.register_model(args.model, args.model, f"models/{args.model}")
        pipeline = MedicalInferencePipeline(registry, config=load_config())
        
        # Get input text
        input_text = get_input_text(args)
        
        # Execute task
        if args.task == "classification":
            classifier = TextClassifier(pipeline, config=load_config())
            result = classifier.classify(input_text, return_probabilities=args.return_probabilities)
        elif args.task == "ner":
            ner_processor = NERProcessor(pipeline, config=load_config())
            result = ner_processor.extract_entities(input_text)
            if args.link_entities:
                result = ner_processor.link_entities(result, ontology=args.ontology)
        elif args.task == "generation":
            generator = TextGenerator(pipeline, config=load_config())
            result = generator.generate(input_text, max_length=args.max_length, temperature=args.temperature)
        
        # Print result
        print(result.to_json())
        
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"Error: {str(e)}", file=sys.stderr)
        return 1
        
    return 0

def get_input_text(args):
    if args.input:
        return args.input
    elif args.input_file:
        with open(args.input_file, 'r') as f:
            return f.read()
    else:
        # Read from stdin if no input specified
        return sys.stdin.read()

if __name__ == "__main__":
    sys.exit(main())
```

subtasks.title: Design CLI structure and argument parsing
subtasks.description: Create the overall structure of the command-line interface and implement argument parsing functionality
subtasks.details: Define the command hierarchy, subcommands, and options. Implement argument parsing using a library like argparse or click. Create a clear help system that explains available commands. Design flags for model selection, input/output paths, and configuration options. Document the CLI structure with a diagram or schema.

subtasks.title: Implement model/task selection and input handling
subtasks.description: Develop the functionality to select models, specify tasks, and process various input formats
subtasks.details: Create mechanisms to select between different AI models. Implement task specification (e.g., summarization, entity extraction). Build handlers for different input formats (text files, PDFs, direct input). Add validation for inputs and configurations. Ensure proper error handling for invalid model/task combinations.

subtasks.title: Add user guidance and error messages
subtasks.description: Enhance the CLI with comprehensive user guidance and clear error messages
subtasks.details: Implement contextual help messages for each command and option. Create detailed error messages with suggestions for resolution. Add warnings for potential issues (e.g., large input files). Include examples in help text. Design a consistent message format for errors, warnings, and information.

subtasks.title: Integrate progress indicators and example commands
subtasks.description: Add visual feedback for long-running operations and provide example commands for common tasks
subtasks.details: Implement progress bars or spinners for time-consuming operations. Add estimated time remaining where possible. Create a library of example commands for common medical NLP tasks. Include a 'examples' command that shows use cases. Add verbose output options for debugging and detailed operation information.

subtasks.title: Write end-to-end and user acceptance tests
subtasks.description: Develop comprehensive testing for the CLI functionality and usability
subtasks.details: Create automated end-to-end tests covering all major CLI functions. Develop user acceptance test scripts with expected outputs. Test error handling and edge cases. Include performance testing for large inputs. Create a test suite that can be run during CI/CD. Document testing procedures and expected results.

tasks.title: Implement Fine-Tuning Capabilities
tasks.description: Develop functionality to fine-tune Med vLLM models on custom medical datasets while preserving efficiency.
tasks.details:
Create fine-tuning capabilities for Med vLLM:
1. Implement `Trainer` class for fine-tuning medical models
2. Add support for different medical datasets and formats
3. Implement efficient training techniques (gradient accumulation, mixed precision)
4. Create checkpointing and model saving functionality
5. Add evaluation during training

Example implementation:
```python
class MedicalModelTrainer:
    def __init__(self, model, config):
        self.model = model
        self.config = config
        self.optimizer = None
        self.scheduler = None
        
    def prepare_for_training(self):
        # Set model to training mode
        self.model.train()
        
        # Create optimizer
        self.optimizer = torch.optim.AdamW(
            self.model.parameters(),
            lr=self.config.learning_rate,
            weight_decay=self.config.weight_decay
        )
        
        # Create learning rate scheduler
        self.scheduler = get_scheduler(
            self.config.scheduler_type,
            optimizer=self.optimizer,
            num_warmup_steps=self.config.warmup_steps,
            num_training_steps=self.config.total_steps
        )
        
    def train(self, train_dataset, eval_dataset=None, output_dir="./fine_tuned_model"):
        # Prepare model for training
        self.prepare_for_training()
        
        # Create data loaders
        train_dataloader = DataLoader(
            train_dataset,
            batch_size=self.config.batch_size,
            shuffle=True
        )
        
        eval_dataloader = None
        if eval_dataset:
            eval_dataloader = DataLoader(
                eval_dataset,
                batch_size=self.config.eval_batch_size
            )
        
        # Training loop
        for epoch in range(self.config.num_epochs):
            self._train_epoch(train_dataloader, epoch)
            
            # Evaluate if dataset provided
            if eval_dataloader:
                metrics = self._evaluate(eval_dataloader)
                print(f"Epoch {epoch} evaluation: {metrics}")
            
            # Save checkpoint
            self._save_checkpoint(output_dir, f"checkpoint-{epoch}")
        
        # Save final model
        self._save_model(output_dir)
        
    def _train_epoch(self, dataloader, epoch):
        # Training logic for one epoch
        # ...
        
    def _evaluate(self, dataloader):
        # Evaluation logic
        # ...
        
    def _save_checkpoint(self, output_dir, checkpoint_name):
        # Save training checkpoint
        # ...
        
    def _save_model(self, output_dir):
        # Save final fine-tuned model
        # ...
```
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Unit tests for training functionality
2. Integration tests with small medical datasets
3. Evaluation of fine-tuned models on medical benchmarks
4. Performance tests for training speed and memory usage
5. Tests for checkpoint saving and loading
6. Comparison tests against baseline fine-tuning approaches
7. Tests for different optimization strategies

subtasks.title: Implement Trainer Class Core Functionality
subtasks.description: Develop the core Trainer class with basic training loop functionality, gradient computation, and parameter updates.
subtasks.details: Create a modular Trainer class that handles the training loop, forward/backward passes, and parameter updates. Implement configurable batch processing, device management (CPU/GPU/TPU), and basic logging. Ensure the class has a clean API with initialization, training, and inference methods.

subtasks.title: Add Support for Medical Datasets and Formats
subtasks.description: Implement data loading and preprocessing for various medical datasets and file formats (DICOM, NIfTI, etc.).
subtasks.details: Create dataset adapters for common medical imaging formats. Implement preprocessing pipelines for normalization, augmentation, and transformation. Support both 2D and 3D medical data. Add handling for metadata and annotations. Ensure efficient data loading with proper caching mechanisms.

subtasks.title: Integrate Efficient Training Techniques
subtasks.description: Implement advanced training techniques like mixed precision, gradient accumulation, and distributed training.
subtasks.details: Add support for mixed precision training (FP16/BF16) to reduce memory usage. Implement gradient accumulation for larger effective batch sizes. Add distributed training capabilities (DDP, DeepSpeed). Optimize memory usage with gradient checkpointing. Implement efficient data parallelism strategies for medical imaging models.

subtasks.title: Develop Checkpointing and Model Saving
subtasks.description: Implement robust checkpointing, model saving, and training state recovery mechanisms.
subtasks.details: Create a checkpointing system that saves model weights, optimizer state, scheduler state, and training progress. Implement automatic checkpointing at configurable intervals. Add functionality to resume training from checkpoints. Support model export in various formats (ONNX, TorchScript). Implement versioning for saved models.

subtasks.title: Add Evaluation During Training
subtasks.description: Implement evaluation metrics and validation loops that run during the training process.
subtasks.details: Add support for medical-specific evaluation metrics (Dice, IoU, Hausdorff distance, etc.). Implement configurable validation loops that run at specified intervals. Create visualization tools for model predictions during training. Add early stopping based on validation metrics. Implement logging of evaluation results to various backends (TensorBoard, W&B, etc.).

subtasks.title: Support Different Optimization Strategies
subtasks.description: Implement various optimizers, learning rate schedulers, and regularization techniques.
subtasks.details: Add support for multiple optimizers (SGD, Adam, AdamW, etc.). Implement learning rate schedulers (step, cosine, one-cycle, etc.). Add regularization techniques (weight decay, dropout, etc.). Support layer-wise learning rates for transfer learning. Implement gradient clipping and normalization.

subtasks.title: Comprehensive Testing and Benchmarking
subtasks.description: Develop test suite and benchmarking tools to validate the fine-tuning pipeline.
subtasks.details: Create unit tests for all components of the Trainer class. Implement integration tests for the full fine-tuning pipeline. Develop benchmarking tools to measure training speed, memory usage, and model performance. Test with various medical datasets and model architectures. Create documentation and examples showcasing the fine-tuning capabilities.

tasks.title: Implement Performance Optimization and Quantization
tasks.description: Optimize Med vLLM for performance in medical environments and implement quantization for efficient deployment.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Unit tests for quantization functionality
2. Performance benchmarks before and after optimization
3. Memory usage tests with different configurations
4. Accuracy tests to ensure quantization doesn't significantly impact results
5. Tests on different hardware (CPU, GPU, etc.)
6. Stress tests with large medical texts
7. Comparison tests against baseline Nano vLLM performance

subtasks.title: Implement Quantization Techniques
subtasks.description: Develop and implement 8-bit and 4-bit quantization methods for medical AI models
subtasks.details: Research and implement post-training quantization techniques specifically for medical models. Create conversion utilities that can transform full-precision models to 8-bit and 4-bit representations while preserving critical diagnostic features. Document quantization approaches and their impact on model size and inference speed.

subtasks.title: Optimize Key Operations for Medical Models
subtasks.description: Identify and optimize computationally intensive operations specific to medical AI applications
subtasks.details: Profile medical models to identify computational bottlenecks. Optimize key operations like convolutions, attention mechanisms, and specialized medical image processing functions. Implement operation fusion where possible and develop specialized kernels for medical-specific operations. Test optimizations against medical datasets to ensure preservation of diagnostic accuracy.

subtasks.title: Extend Memory Management
subtasks.description: Develop enhanced memory management techniques for large medical models and datasets
subtasks.details: Implement gradient checkpointing, activation recomputation, and other memory-saving techniques. Create memory profiling tools specific to medical workloads. Develop strategies for efficient handling of large 3D medical volumes and time-series data. Implement memory pooling and recycling mechanisms to reduce allocation overhead during inference.

subtasks.title: Develop Benchmarking Tools
subtasks.description: Create comprehensive benchmarking suite for measuring optimization impacts
subtasks.details: Develop tools to measure inference time, memory usage, power consumption, and throughput. Create standardized medical AI benchmarks using representative datasets. Implement automated regression testing to catch performance degradations. Design visualization tools to compare performance metrics before and after optimizations.

subtasks.title: Create Deployment Profiles
subtasks.description: Develop optimization profiles for different deployment scenarios
subtasks.details: Create optimization profiles for edge devices (mobile, embedded), on-premise servers, and cloud deployments. Develop configuration systems that can automatically select the best optimization strategy based on hardware capabilities and requirements. Document deployment recommendations for different clinical settings and use cases.

subtasks.title: Validate Accuracy Post-Optimization
subtasks.description: Ensure optimized models maintain clinical-grade accuracy
subtasks.details: Develop validation protocols to compare optimized models against original versions. Implement statistical tests to verify diagnostic equivalence. Create visualization tools to highlight areas of potential accuracy degradation. Establish minimum accuracy thresholds for different medical applications. Consult with clinical experts to validate that optimizations preserve medically relevant features.

subtasks.title: Test on Various Hardware
subtasks.description: Validate optimizations across diverse hardware platforms
subtasks.details: Test optimized models on CPUs, GPUs, TPUs, and specialized medical hardware. Validate performance on edge devices commonly used in clinical settings. Measure and document performance characteristics across hardware types. Create hardware-specific optimization paths where necessary. Develop compatibility layers for hardware-specific acceleration libraries.
